title: Is there a temporary equivalent of user.js?
content: Preferences in user.js are added permanently to prefs.js and persist even after user.js is deleted. What if you want to specify preferences in a file, just like with user.js, but you don't want them to be made permanent? In other words, so that when the file is deleted, the prefs will be forgotten. Is there any way to do this?
creator: mc510

title: Sound goes mute while watching SlingTv on the laptop. Does not do it on Chrome.  Why??
creator: fordlightning

title: Firefox bookmarks
content: When a new bookmark is created it goes to the end of the bookmark listing in the left panel. How can I force Firefox to automatically put each newly created bookmark in the correct alphabetic position in the left panel Bookmarks panel? I DO NOT want to alphabetize the entire panel, I just want each newly created bookmark to go where is alphabetically belongs. I do not use folders so have one long list for bookmarks menu. thank Bob
creator: SeniorSpan
